div.ab: In a Toletan MS of Galen is a note Dno Moyse Susani filio with his friend Joanne Moysis filio Ben Feris. read this work 25 Novr aerae Sapharensis id est Hispanae 1422. Xti 1384 idque in urbe Toleto quam deus servet incolumem. A Jew & Xtian Physician of Toledo. Also there notes Xtiani duce Rege Ferrando urbem Jaen recuperarunt die 4 Martis ao Xt 1245. Hispalim 26 Aprilis 1248. Tharifam 21 Sept ao 1340. 1257 Nieblam.
Alphonsus Rex astronomus ob Heg 683 1284 of Xt.
Sanchus obiit Toleti 26 April. 1295 Xt.
obiit Rex Ferrandus in Jaen 7 Sept 1310.
Obt ejus filius Rex Alphonsus in monte expugnationis id est Gibelthar 26 Martii. Xt 1350
Ejus filius Rex Petrus 1368
Rex Henricus 1379
Rex Johannes equo prolapsus ao 1390
Rex Henricus obt Toleti 20 decr. 1432

Regina Catharina obt in Valladolid in Arabic Baladualid بلد الوليدValladolid Arabic not present on p. 248 of Casiri. WG has taken it from elsewhere. id est urbs principis Mauritani Valid ao 1418From Casiri, Bibliotheca, vol. 1, p. 248. In a Toletan Manuscript of Galen is a note: Lord Moses, son of Susanus, with his friend Joannes Moses, son of Ben Ferus, read this work 25 November 1422 in the period of Safar [second month of the Islamic calendar], that is of Spain. 1384AD. And that in the city of Toledo, which may God keep safe. A Jew and Christian Physician of Toledo. Also there notes the Christians, led by King Fernando, retook the city of Jaen on 4 March 1245AD [Casiri has 1243]. Seville, 26 April 1248. Tarifa 21 September 1340. Niebla, 1257. King Alfonso the astronomer died AH 683, 1284AD. Sancho died at Toledo, 26 April 1295AD. King Fernando died at Jaen, 7 September 1310. His son, King Alfonso, died at the mountain of storms, that is, Gibraltar, 26 March 1350AD His son, King Pedro, 1368 King Enrique, 1379 King Juan fell off his horse in the year 1390 King Enrique died at Toledo, 20 December 1432 Queen Catalina [Catherine of Lancaster] died at Valladolid, in Arabic Baladualid, that is the city of the Moorish leader Valid, in the year 1418 – all notes in this book – p248i.e. Casiri, Bibliotheca, vol. 1, p. 248.
Corans without number p486Casiri, Bibliotheca, vol. 1, p. 486, though the books there are actually commentaries on the Quran.

Explanation of MahomMahometan faith by Abu Abdallah Mohamad ben Joseph Abderita for Abi Abdalla Mohammad King of Granada who was of the Nasserites & died Hegirae 733AH 733From Casiri, Bibliotheca, vol. 1, p. 526.
div.note: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم In the name of God (Allah) the most gracious and merciful
div.ab: Codex – Comment on Khalil ben Isaac great Lawyer by Scharapheddin Althakhikhi Lawyer of Granada.
Same epitomized by Abdelrahman Alagehuri of Granada.
Same in 8 Vols by Nassereddin Alzarcani of Granada.
Abdallah Ben Mohamad Ben Zakri Heg 838AH 838 Lawyer of Granada.
Admonitions to Judges &c Heg 896AH 896 by Abu Abdallah Mohamad Ben Abdalla vulgo Almoknasicommonly called Almoknasi chief judge of Granada.
Of Cordova Abu Othman Sada Ben Abi Giaphar Ahmad Ben Leon Altagibi Law,
div.note: أبو عثمان سعد بن احمد بن ليون التجيبيAbu Othman Saad bin Ahmed bin Leon Al-Tajibi [writer, b. AH681, 1282AD, from Almería]
div.ab: Copy of Codex Cuph in urbe Guadix Heg 820 de Jurisprudentie carmen – Auctor Abu Giaphar Mohamad of Granada 790 Heg.Copy of Kufic Codex in the City of Guadix, AH 820, Poem on Jurisprudence – Author Abu Giaphar Mohamad of Granada, AH 790.

Book of Kings Tributes & Rents of Cordova Heg 677 Xti 1278AH 677 or 1278AD, by Abu Giaphar Ben Nasser Alravadi of Cordova. Orders that XtiansChristians when conquered by Mahometans may have lauds & Churches
Even books from Bokharai.e. Bukhara, in present-day Uzbekistan in Spain.
Abdelrahman Alagehuri of Granada Civil law,
Poem on Logic & Algebra by a Cordovan Author with Comment by Ben Ali ben David Almosarati of Granada 7th century Heg7th century AH.
Book of Both Laws or Pandects.

Book to confute the Mahometan methodistsWG's interpretation. Casiri (vol. 1, p. 483) has 'severiores Alcorani sectatores' (strict followers of the Quran). who would not allow of music &c well confuted.
